fu.geo

Class HGTAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.geo.HGTAccess

  • public class HGTAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    Access to NASA's height profiles. A user first has to get the corresponding HGT files under STRM3 (all files in Zipped HGT format). The NASA files names have to be preserved.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HGTAccess(java.lang.String directory, int cacheSize)
      Start using height profiles.

      • HGTAccess

        public HGTAccess(java.lang.String directory,
         int cacheSize)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Start using height profiles.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory that contains the Zipped HGT files
        cacheSize - number of files held in memory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getRaw

        public double[][] getRaw(double latitude,
                double longitude,
                int[][] indexes)
        Queries original measured data, not interpolated. The query takes a coordinate and assing index 0/0 to the nearest measured point to this coordinate. 1/0 means: the next measured point with latitude +1 deg.
        Parameters:
        latitude - the query point latitude
        longitude - the query point longitude
        Returns:
        an array of measured points where [0]: lat, [1]: long, [2]: height (NaN of void point)

      • getRaw

        public double[] getRaw(double latitude,
              double longitude)
        Return the nearest raw measured point.
        Returns:
        measured point where [0]: lat, [1]: long, [2]: height (NaN of void point)

      • height

        public double height(double latitude,
            double longitude)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the height of a certain coordinate. If the coordinate resides inside a tile between measured points, a simple interpolation approach is used with the properties:
        • it is continuous (esp. between tiles)
        • at measured point the measured results are returned
        If one of the nearest measured points is a void point, the height is also set to void.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a void point is computed or the height map does not cover this point.

      • gradient

        public double[] gradient(double latitude,
                double longitude,
                double stepwidth)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the gradient of the position. The gradient tells the downhill direction, i.e. the direction with the largest steepness to a local valley. Note that we use a simple approximation, thus the real gradient may slightly differ.
        Parameters:
        width - in degrees to look for reference points to check the slope. Note that too small values will result in high noise, too large values will smooth any details
        Returns:
        [0]: height [1]: slope in meters per meters, [2]: steepest direction downhill (in 360 degrees), 0: east, 90: north, 180: west, -90: south
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • contourLines

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<double[]>>> contourLines(double[] heights,
                                                                                   double fromLat,
                                                                                   double fromLon,
                                                                                   double toLat,
                                                                                   double toLon,
                                                                                   double pixelPerDeg)
        Computes the contour lines of a certain height in a certain coordinate interval.
        Parameters:
        heights: - a list of heights in meters, for which the lines should be generated
        fromLat - rectangle for which the contour lines should be generated
        fromLon - rectangle for which the contour lines should be generated
        toLat - rectangle for which the contour lines should be generated
        toLon - rectangle for which the contour lines should be generated
        pixelPerDeg - image resolution - this affects the granularity of contour lines
        Returns:
        a list of contour lines wheras the index corresponds the the height in the heights param. Each list contains a list of line portions, containing double[2] (lat, lon)
